attributes.action: Boris Johnson and No 10 insulted and humiliated Her Majesty. He must resign.
attributes.additional_details:
Boris Johnson and No 10 have insulted and deeply hurt Her Majesty the Queen by forcing her to mourn alone during Prince Philip's funeral, whilst having broken those same regulations themselves by partying just the night before.

The Prime Minister has insulted The Crown and everything it represents: the country, the people of this country, and its values.

Boris didn't just insult and humiliate Her Majesty, he insulted us all.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about honours or appointments, which includes calling for Ministers or the Government to be sacked, resign, or to be subject to a recall vote or a vote of no confidence.

In any case, we cannot accept petitions that include accusations of wrongdoing, or statements that may be libellous or defamatory, against an identifiable person, organisation or government. This includes accusations of breaching Covid-19 regulations.
 
Decisions about investigating alleged offences and prosecuting these are a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or Parliament. 
 
The Government has published terms of reference for an investigation into allegations of gatherings that took place or may have taken place last year: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/terms-of-reference-for-the-cabinet-secretarys-investigations
 
The terms of reference for the above investigation state that if during the course of the work any evidence emerges of behaviour that is potentially a criminal offence, the matter will be referred to the police.
